titleproper.value: Preliminary Inventory to the Feminist Organization for Communication, Action and Service (FOCAS) Records <num>TAM 234</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-08T14:46:13</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Feminist Organization for Communication, Action and Service (FOCAS) Records

p.value: Provenance unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1979.007.

The Feminist Organization for Communication, Action and Service (FOCAS), a New York City-based feminist organization founded circa 1971 by women formerly active in the Women's Strike Coalition, an initiative of the Socialist Workers Party, a Trotskyist group, was active throughout the 1970s, and sought to create coalitions with other women's groups, initiate actions, hold forums and disseminate information. FOCAS published a newsletter, <emph render="italic">Majority Report</emph> (1971-1978), a complete run of which is held by the Tamiment Library.

The FOCAS Collection's internal organization files document the group's divisive separation from its socialist roots and mark its development into one of the earliest, most successful independent manifestations of the Women's Liberation movement. The Collection offers an inside look at an internecine battle and a struggle for identity that is representative of battles like it that occurred all across various sectors of the women's movement in the late sixties and early seventies. The Collection's internal files also follow FOCAS as it works to establish a non-patriarchal, non-hierarchical, coalition-based operating structure that crosses ethnic, racial, sexual, and
political categories. Researchers interested in tracing the genesis and evolution of a representative women's organization from the 1970s will find this structural aspect of the FOCAS Collection valuable.
